proposal_text: Authorize Issuance of Convertible Bonds, Debentures, Warrants, and Other Debt Securities without Preemptive Rights up to EUR 3 Billion
position_paper: Position paper: Shareholder rights in equity issuances
rationale_text: Existing shareholders should have the right to approve share issuances in order to prevent the dilution of ownership without their prior consent. Existing shareholders should have the right to participate pro rata to maintain their voting share and benefit from any discount offered. The approval for a general authority should be reasonably close in time to the intended capital allocation to allow for an informed voting decision.

proposal_text: Elect Bertrand Dumazy as Director
position_paper: Position paper: Time commitment of board members
rationale_text: Board members should devote sufficient time to fulfil their responsibilities effectively. The chairperson is responsible for leading all aspects of the board’s work and should devote a significant amount of time to fulfil his or her responsibilities effectively. Board members should contribute to effective discussions and decision-making by attending all meetings.

proposal_text: Elect Director J. Kent Masters, Jr.
position_paper: Position paper: Separation of chairperson and CEO
rationale_text: The board should exercise objective judgement on corporate affairs and be able to make decisions independently of management. The roles of chairperson and CEO should not be held by the same individual. Where a company founder combines both roles, we may support this for a limited period, provided the board has put in place measures to mitigate any conflicts of interest.

proposal_text: Adopt Simple Majority Vote
rationale_text: Anti-takeover measures are generally not in the interest of shareholders, and the introduction of such measures should, at a minimum, be subject to shareholder approval. We define anti-takeover measures to include any mechanism likely to deter or frustrate takeovers.

proposal_text: Report on Lobbying Payments and Policy
rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Provide Right to Act by Written Consent
rationale_text: Shareholders should in certain circumstances have the opportunity to raise issues of material importance without having to wait for management to schedule a meeting. All proposals subject to shareholder approval should be presented as individual items, and the vote tally should be published.

proposal_text: Re-approve Treasury Share Unit Plan
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Elect Director Jeffrey Wadsworth
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Adopt Simple Majority Vote
rationale_text: Anti-takeover measures are generally not in the interest of shareholders, and the introduction of such measures should, at a minimum, be subject to shareholder approval. We define anti-takeover measures to include any mechanism likely to deter or frustrate takeovers.

proposal_text: Appoint Auditors and Risk Assessment Companies
rationale_text: The external auditor should act in an independent manner. We will consider the auditor’s independence and any concerns about the accounts or audit procedures. Excessive non-audit-related fees represent a potential conflict of interest and should be avoided.

proposal_text: Elect Directors
rationale_text: The company should have a robust nomination and election process to ensure an effective board that is accountable to shareholders. Shareholders should be able to participate in frequent elections of all board members, preferably on an annual basis. The company should establish reasonable procedures for shareholders to include proposals in the meeting material distributed by the company, including proposing board candidates.

proposal_text: Other Business
rationale_text: We will not support an agenda item if the information disclosed is insufficient to make an informed decision.

proposal_text: Amend Article 7 Re: Capital Related
position_paper: Position paper: Shareholder rights in equity issuances
rationale_text: Existing shareholders should have the right to approve share issuances in order to prevent the dilution of ownership without their prior consent. Existing shareholders should have the right to participate pro rata to maintain their voting share and benefit from any discount offered. The approval for a general authority should be reasonably close in time to the intended capital allocation to allow for an informed voting decision.

proposal_text: Approve Remuneration Report
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Elect Fiscal Council Members
rationale_text: The company should have a robust nomination and election process to ensure an effective board that is accountable to shareholders. Shareholders should be able to participate in frequent elections of all board members, preferably on an annual basis. The company should establish reasonable procedures for shareholders to include proposals in the meeting material distributed by the company, including proposing board candidates.

rationale_text: The board should guide company strategy and monitor management performance without conflicts of interest. proposal_text: Elect Directors
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Re-elect Maria Alban as Director
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Approve Compensation of Sébastien Bazin, Chairman and CEO
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Approve Auditors' Special Report on Related-Party Transactions
rationale_text: Transactions between related parties should be avoided unless they are demonstrably beneficial to all shareholders. The board should disclose the name and affiliation of each party involved, value and cost of the transaction, and business rationale.

proposal_text: Authorize Repurchase of Up to 10 Percent of Issued Share Capital
rationale_text: Anti-takeover measures are generally not in the interest of shareholders, and the introduction of such measures should, at a minimum, be subject to shareholder approval. We define anti-takeover measures to include any mechanism likely to deter or frustrate takeovers.

proposal_text: Provide Right to Act by Written Consent
rationale_text: Shareholders should in certain circumstances have the opportunity to raise issues of material importance without having to wait for management to schedule a meeting. All proposals subject to shareholder approval should be presented as individual items, and the vote tally should be published.

proposal_text: Report on Annual Climate Transition
rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Elect Supervisory Board Member
rationale_text: The company should have a robust nomination and election process to ensure an effective board that is accountable to shareholders. Existing shareholders should have the right to participate pro rata to maintain their voting share and benefit from any discount offered. The approval for a general authority should be reasonably close in time to the intended capital allocation to allow for an informed voting decision.

proposal_text: Reelect Delphine Arnault as Director
rationale_text: The board should guide company strategy and monitor management performance without conflicts of interest. A majority of shareholder-elected board members in a non-controlled company should be independent of management, dominant shareholders, and related third parties. In a majority-controlled company, at least a third of board members should be independent.

proposal_text: Approve Remuneration Report
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Provide Right to Act by Written Consent
rationale_text: Shareholders should in certain circumstances have the opportunity to raise issues of material importance without having to wait for management to schedule a meeting. All proposals subject to shareholder approval should be presented as individual items, and the vote tally should be published.

proposal_text: Elect Director Andrew Wilson
position_paper: Position paper: Separation of chairperson and CEO
rationale_text: The board should exercise objective judgement on corporate affairs and be able to make decisions independently of management. The roles of chairperson and CEO should not be held by the same individual. Where a company founder combines both roles, we may support this for a limited period, provided the board has put in place measures to mitigate any conflicts of interest.

proposal_text: Elect Director Leonard S. Coleman
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Re-elect David Friedland as Director
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Eliminate Multi-class Share Structure
rationale_text: All shareholders should have the right to vote on fundamental corporate decisions, and voting rights should be proportionate to cash flow rights. Any unequal voting rights should be time-limited and aligned with cash flow rights over time.

proposal_text: Re-elect Andrew Leslie as Director
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Elect Director Richard Lenny
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Provide Right to Act by Written Consent
rationale_text: Shareholders should in certain circumstances have the opportunity to raise issues of material importance without having to wait for management to schedule a meeting. All proposals subject to shareholder approval should be presented as individual items, and the vote tally should be published.

rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. proposal_text: Declassify the Board of Directors
rationale_text: The company should have a robust nomination and election process to ensure an effective board that is accountable to shareholders. Shareholders should be able to participate in frequent elections of all board members, preferably on an annual basis. The company should establish reasonable procedures for shareholders to include proposals in the meeting material distributed by the company, including proposing board candidates.

proposal_text: Advisory Vote to Ratify Named Executive Officers' Compensation
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Elect Director Barry Diller
position_paper: Position paper: Time commitment of board members
rationale_text: Board members should devote sufficient time to fulfil their responsibilities effectively. The chairperson is responsible for leading all aspects of the board’s work and should devote a significant amount of time to fulfil his or her responsibilities effectively. Board members should contribute to effective discussions and decision-making by attending all meetings.

rationale_text: Anti-takeover measures are generally not in the interest of shareholders, and the introduction of such measures should, at a minimum, be subject to shareholder approval. We define anti-takeover measures to include any mechanism likely to deter or frustrate takeovers.

proposal_text: Authorize Issuance of Equity or Equity-Linked Securities without Preemptive Rights up to Aggregate Nominal Amount of EUR 6 Million
position_paper: Position paper: Shareholder rights in equity issuances
rationale_text: Existing shareholders should have the right to approve share issuances in order to prevent the dilution of ownership without their prior consent. Existing shareholders should have the right to participate pro rata to maintain their voting share and benefit from any discount offered. The approval for a general authority should be reasonably close in time to the intended capital allocation to allow for an informed voting decision.

proposal_text: Approve Auditors' Special Report on Related-Party Transactions
rationale_text: Transactions between related parties should be avoided unless they are demonstrably beneficial to all shareholders. The board should disclose the name and affiliation of each party involved, value and cost of the transaction, and business rationale.

proposal_text: Approve Remuneration Policy of CEO
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Reelect Jean-Dominique Senard as Director
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Elect Director Takahashi, Kazuo
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

rationale_text: We will not support the re-election of a director, or the entire board, if the company has experienced material failures in the oversight, management or disclosure of social risks.

proposal_text: Ratify and Affirm Decisions and Actions Taken by the Board and Executive Officers for Fiscal 2023
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Elect Director Edward J. "Joe" Shoen
position_paper: Position paper: Separation of chairperson and CEO
rationale_text: The board should exercise objective judgement on corporate affairs and be able to make decisions independently of management. The roles of chairperson and CEO should not be held by the same individual. Where a company founder combines both roles, we may support this for a limited period, provided the board has put in place measures to mitigate any conflicts of interest.

proposal_text: Ratify and Affirm Decisions and Actions Taken by the Board and Executive Officers for Fiscal 2022
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Adopt GHG Emissions Reduction Targets Aligned with the Paris Agreement Goal
rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Approve Remuneration Report
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Reelect Bill Ackman as Non-Executive Director
rationale_text: The board should guide company strategy and monitor management performance without conflicts of interest. A majority of shareholder-elected board members in a non-controlled company should be independent of management, dominant shareholders, and related third parties. In a majority-controlled company, at least a third of board members should be independent.

proposal_text: Approve Discharge of Supervisory Board Member H.D. Poetsch for Fiscal Year 2021
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Ratify Ernst & Young GmbH as Auditors for Fiscal Year 2021
rationale_text: The external auditor should act in an independent manner. We will consider the auditor’s independence and any concerns about the accounts or audit procedures. Excessive non-audit-related fees represent a potential conflict of interest and should be avoided.

rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Elect Hussain Abdulla to the Supervisory Board
rationale_text: The board should guide company strategy and monitor management performance without conflicts of interest. A majority of shareholder-elected board members in a non-controlled company should be independent of management, dominant shareholders, and related third parties. In a majority-controlled company, at least a third of board members should be independent.

proposal_text: Reelect Eric Li (Li Shufu) as Director
position_paper: Position paper: Time commitment of board members
rationale_text: Board members should devote sufficient time to fulfil their responsibilities effectively. The chairperson is responsible for leading all aspects of the board’s work and should devote a significant amount of time to fulfil his or her responsibilities effectively. Board members should contribute to effective discussions and decision-making by attending all meetings.

proposal_text: Reelect Lone Fonss Schroder as Director
rationale_text: Board decisions that are particularly vulnerable to conflicts of interest should have additional safeguards. Management should not serve on the audit or remuneration committees. The audit committee should have a majority of independent, shareholder-elected members.

proposal_text: Reelect Daniel Li (Li Donghui) as Director
rationale_text: Board decisions that are particularly vulnerable to conflicts of interest should have additional safeguards. Management should not serve on the audit or remuneration committees. The audit committee should have a majority of independent, shareholder-elected members.

proposal_text: Advisory Vote to Ratify Named Executive Officers' Compensation
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Report on Health and Safety Governance
rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Elect Director Charles R. Morrison
position_paper: Position paper: Separation of chairperson and CEO
rationale_text: The board should exercise objective judgement on corporate affairs and be able to make decisions independently of management. The roles of chairperson and CEO should not be held by the same individual. Where a company founder combines both roles, we may support this for a limited period, provided the board has put in place measures to mitigate any conflicts of interest.

proposal_text: Elect Director Juan R. Luciano
position_paper: Position paper: Separation of chairperson and CEO
rationale_text: The board should exercise objective judgement on corporate affairs and be able to make decisions independently of management. The roles of chairperson and CEO should not be held by the same individual. Where a company founder combines both roles, we may support this for a limited period, provided the board has put in place measures to mitigate any conflicts of interest.

proposal_text: Report on Pesticide Use in the Company's Supply Chain
rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Reelect Fernando Aguirre as Director
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Authorize Issuance of Equity or Equity-Linked Securities without Preemptive Rights up to Aggregate Nominal Amount of EUR 165 Million
position_paper: Position paper: Shareholder rights in equity issuances
rationale_text: Existing shareholders should have the right to approve share issuances in order to prevent the dilution of ownership without their prior consent. Existing shareholders should have the right to participate pro rata to maintain their voting share and benefit from any discount offered. The approval for a general authority should be reasonably close in time to the intended capital allocation to allow for an informed voting decision.

proposal_text: Report on Median Gender/Racial Pay Gap
rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

The chairperson is responsible for leading all aspects of the board’s work and should devote a significant amount of time to fulfil his or her responsibilities effectively. Board members should contribute to effective discussions and decision-making by attending all meetings.

proposal_text: Elect Director Michael D. Hsu
position_paper: Position paper: Separation of chairperson and CEO
rationale_text: The board should exercise objective judgement on corporate affairs and be able to make decisions independently of management. The roles of chairperson and CEO should not be held by the same individual. Where a company founder combines both roles, we may support this for a limited period, provided the board has put in place measures to mitigate any conflicts of interest.

rationale_text: Shareholders should in certain circumstances have the opportunity to raise issues of material importance without having to wait for management to schedule a meeting. proposal_text: Authorize Board to Repurchase Shares in the Event of a Serious and Imminent Harm and Under Normal Conditions
rationale_text: Anti-takeover measures are generally not in the interest of shareholders, and the introduction of such measures should, at a minimum, be subject to shareholder approval. We define anti-takeover measures to include any mechanism likely to deter or frustrate takeovers.

proposal_text: Authorize Board to Issue Shares in the Event of a Public Tender Offer or Share Exchange Offer and Renew Authorization to Increase Share Capital within the Framework of Authorized Capital
position_paper: Position paper: Shareholder rights in equity issuances
rationale_text: Existing shareholders should have the right to approve share issuances in order to prevent the dilution of ownership without their prior consent. Existing shareholders should have the right to participate pro rata to maintain their voting share and benefit from any discount offered. The approval for a general authority should be reasonably close in time to the intended capital allocation to allow for an informed voting decision.

rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Re-elect Christo Wiese as Director
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

proposal_text: Approve Remuneration Policy
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

rationale_text: The board should use the annual report to present a fair, sensible and clear assessment of the company. This includes any potential legal action, misstatements or goodwill write-offs, and substantial governance shortcomings.

rationale_text: The company should have a robust nomination and election process to ensure an effective board that is accountable to shareholders. Shareholders should be able to participate in frequent elections of all board members, preferably on an annual basis. The company should establish reasonable procedures for shareholders to include proposals in the meeting material distributed by the company, including proposing board candidates.

proposal_text: Approve Second Section of the Remuneration Report
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Elect Director Darren W. Woods
position_paper: Position paper: Separation of chairperson and CEO
rationale_text: The board should exercise objective judgement on corporate affairs and be able to make decisions independently of management. The roles of chairperson and CEO should not be held by the same individual. Where a company founder combines both roles, we may support this for a limited period, provided the board has put in place measures to mitigate any conflicts of interest.

proposal_text: Elect Director Joseph L. Hooley
rationale_text: Norges Bank Investment Management voted against Joseph L. Hooley in his capacity as Exxon Mobil Corporation's Lead Independent Director and Chair of the Nominating and Governance committee due to Exxon Mobil's decision to file a lawsuit against shareholders related to the submission of a shareholder proposal. While we appreciate the significant value generated during Mr. Hooley's tenure as Lead Independent Director, Norges Bank Investment Management continues to place utmost importance on the protection of shareholder rights and raises concern around the potential impacts of litigation against shareholders stemming from the submission of a shareholder proposal. We will continue to seek constructive dialog with Exxon Mobil on this and other topics.

We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

rationale_text: Board members should devote sufficient time to fulfil their responsibilities effectively. rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

The company should establish reasonable procedures for shareholders to include proposals in the meeting material distributed by the company, including proposing board candidates.

proposal_text: Elect Directors
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.

position_paper: Position paper: Separation of chairperson and CEO
rationale_text: The board should exercise objective judgement on corporate affairs and be able to make decisions independently of management. The roles of chairperson and CEO should not be held by the same individual. Where a company founder combines both roles, we may support this for a limited period, provided the board has put in place measures to mitigate any conflicts of interest.

proposal_text: Adopt GHG Emissions Reduction Targets Aligned with the Paris Agreement Goal
rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

position_paper: Position paper: Time commitment of board members
rationale_text: Board members should devote sufficient time to fulfil their responsibilities effectively. The chairperson is responsible for leading all aspects of the board’s work and should devote a significant amount of time to fulfil his or her responsibilities effectively. Board members should contribute to effective discussions and decision-making by attending all meetings.

proposal_text: Approve Mandatory Conversion of Saving Shares into Ordinary Shares; Amend Bylaws Re: Articles 5, 6, and 11
Approve Second Section of the Remuneration Report
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Advisory Vote to Ratify Named Executive Officers' Compensation
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Approve Share Repurchase
rationale_text: Anti-takeover measures are generally not in the interest of shareholders, and the introduction of such measures should, at a minimum, be subject to shareholder approval. We define anti-takeover measures to include any mechanism likely to deter or frustrate takeovers.

proposal_text: Approve Renewal of Authorized Share Capital and Related Authorizations and Waivers
position_paper: Position paper: Shareholder rights in equity issuances
rationale_text: Existing shareholders should have the right to approve share issuances in order to prevent the dilution of ownership without their prior consent. Existing shareholders should have the right to participate pro rata to maintain their voting share and benefit from any discount offered. The approval for a general authority should be reasonably close in time to the intended capital allocation to allow for an informed voting decision.

proposal_text: Approve Remuneration Report
rationale_text: The board is responsible for attracting the right CEO and setting appropriate remuneration. A substantial proportion of annual remuneration should be provided as shares that are locked in for five to ten years, regardless of resignation or retirement. The board should provide transparency on total remuneration to avoid unacceptable outcomes. The board should ensure that all benefits have a clear business rationale. Pensionable income should constitute a minor part of total remuneration.

proposal_text: Approve Share Repurchase
rationale_text: Anti-takeover measures are generally not in the interest of shareholders, and the introduction of such measures should, at a minimum, be subject to shareholder approval. We define anti-takeover measures to include any mechanism likely to deter or frustrate takeovers.

proposal_text: Approve Renewal of the Share Capital Authorization of the Company
position_paper: Position paper: Shareholder rights in equity issuances
rationale_text: Existing shareholders should have the right to approve share issuances in order to prevent the dilution of ownership without their prior consent. Existing shareholders should have the right to participate pro rata to maintain their voting share and benefit from any discount offered. The approval for a general authority should be reasonably close in time to the intended capital allocation to allow for an informed voting decision.

proposal_text: Report on Climate Transition Plan and GHG Emissions Reduction Targets
rationale_text: The board should account for material sustainability risks facing the company, and the broader environmental and social consequences of its operations and products. Sustainability disclosures should be aligned with applicable global reporting standards and frameworks to support investors in their analysis of risks and opportunities. Where a company’s disclosure does not meet our needs as a financial investor, we will consider supporting a well-founded shareholder proposal calling for reasonable disclosure. We will not support a shareholder proposal that appears to impose a strategy or prescribe detailed methods, unrealistic timeframes or targets for implementation.

proposal_text: Elect Directors
rationale_text: The board should guide company strategy and monitor management performance without conflicts of interest. A majority of shareholder-elected board members in a non-controlled company should be independent of management, dominant shareholders, and related third parties. In a majority-controlled company, at least a third of board members should be independent.

proposal_text: Elect Directors
rationale_text: The board should guide company strategy and monitor management performance without conflicts of interest. A majority of shareholder-elected board members in a non-controlled company should be independent of management, dominant shareholders, and related third parties. In a majority-controlled company, at least a third of board members should be independent.

proposal_text: Elect Directors
rationale_text: The company should have a robust nomination and election process to ensure an effective board that is accountable to shareholders. Shareholders should be able to participate in frequent elections of all board members, preferably on an annual basis. The company should establish reasonable procedures for shareholders to include proposals in the meeting material distributed by the company, including proposing board candidates.

proposal_text: Accept Financial Statements
rationale_text: The board should use the annual report to present a fair, sensible and clear assessment of the company. The report should be reflective of the prior year, and include material risk factors. We will consider whether any information available raises reasonable doubt about the financial statements. This includes any potential legal action, misstatements or goodwill write-offs, and substantial governance shortcomings.

proposal_text: Approve Discharge of Board
rationale_text: Shareholders should have the right to seek changes to the board when it does not act in their best interest. We will consider whether the board has failed to act on material requests from shareholders, sought to circumvent shareholder proposals or implemented governance changes limiting shareholders’ rights without their approval. When voting on a proposal to discharge the board of responsibilities, we will consider whether any information raises reasonable doubt about the board’s actions. We will also take into considerations unsatisfactory financial and strategic performance, mismanaged risk-taking, unacceptable treatment of stakeholders or undesired environmental or social outcomes from company operations.
